meta.title: About
meta.description: Learn about my background in operations, leadership, and software development.

summary.body: My career has moved through several domains: operations, leadership, business systems, and software development. I’ve supervised teams, coached and developed people, handled complex workflows, and created tools to help work happen with more clarity and less friction.

story: I began in hands-on operational roles where clarity and structure were essential. Managing people taught me how systems break down at the human level: misaligned expectations, unclear responsibilities, and missing feedback loops.

Later, I started developing software independently. Without a team to divide responsibilities, I had to design architecture, implement features, manage complexity, and refine systems on my own. This taught me to approach problems holistically — carrying both the technical and operational perspectives simultaneously.
Today, I rely on both sides of that background. I build systems that help people do meaningful work with clarity and confidence.

systemsAndOperations: Translating real-world requirements into actionable structure
leadershipAndPeople: Creating clarity in moments of uncertainty
softwareAndArchitecture: Independently building internal tools and platforms
Designing developer workflows and reasoning structures

values: Clarity — People work best when expectations and systems are simple and honest.
Calm Structure — Good systems reduce noise and help people focus.
Transparency — Understanding should be visible and shared.
Human-Centered Design — Tools should support the work, not complicate it.
auroraOriginSafe: Aurora began as a series of questions about clarity, communication, and workflow.
Aurora grew from the idea that software creation could feel more conversational, more explainable, and more aligned with how people naturally communicate.
personalNotes: I enjoy designing systems in any context — work, tools, writing, or personal organization.
I appreciate environments where clarity and purpose matter, and where thoughtful design makes work feel lighter.
